channel.title: How do you make a mmorpg?
channel.description:
Hey guys, i want to make a mmorpg like runescape! But i don't no where to start! If you could help me with the basics i would very grateful this is what i am looking to be makking in my game;
3D, Make your own cities, Download base (play from desktop) Gud graphics
Not that much to ask for (im hoping ^^)
Also i don't mind doing a little bit of scripting!
Thankyou for your help, johno

item.title: How do you make a mmorpg?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

It was over some textures that we ripped from somewhere.

I cbf going into the details.

Anyways I hope you have fun with blitzbasic, but just remember they are not very powerful languages. Just very easy and fun to play with. Our game was going to have a free version, so although the graphics sucked it probably could have been pretty fun for free. .

Our website is long gone though, but I found some very old screenshots to show what blitz can do. And yes I am aware how shitty it looks.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make a mmorpg?

item.title: How do you make a mmorpg?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:10, topic:230635”][quote author=jme link=topic=303660.msg2435562#msg2435562 date=1221172775]
Cost is another big issue. We spent thousands of dollars on our game, and we have nothing to show for it. It was all a waste. And a waste of 2 years as well.
[/quote]

Out of curiosity, what did you spend the money on?[/quote]

We were paying 150 a month on a server, which ran for about 2 years. Thats about 3600 dollars right there. Then we hired several 3D modellers to make us some original characters, buildings, etc. And we also purchased many 3D models off websites. And we had to pay people for odd jobs, as we were a 2 man team with little idea what the fuck we were doing.

We received over 500 dollars in donations though, and we got some ad money. But in the end we lost a few thousand.

Oh, and I was about thiiiiis close to being sued.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make a mmorpg?

item.title: How do you make a mmorpg?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

There are no magic “make WoW” or “make Runescape” buttons that you can press. It takes a large team and many years of hard frustrating work to make a good mmorpg. As for making 3D models, just search for 3D modelling software and for some tutorials to use them (as most of them are not very straight forward). Search for Blender if you want a free one, or wings3d for a very easy (and very limited) free program. Or find a torrent/crack for 3d studio max, Maya, or any other 3d software you want.

Or be a cheap-ass and make a really shitty game with some lame drag n drop game engine editor. Such as Torque, or RC. Though your game WILL be crap and no one will play because it looks the exact same as every other game made by those engines.

Or be a slightly-less of a cheap-ass and use an easy programming language made for games, such as blitz3d or dark basic. This is what we did, though we did fail (after getting pretty far though).

Here is what started my game: http://sourceforge.net/projects/servant
It’s a pretty good engine for blitz3d. Just needs a few years of work to get a good game out of it. Go to www.blitzbasic.com to learn more.

Cost is another big issue. We spent thousands of dollars on our game, and we have nothing to show for it. It was all a waste. And a waste of 2 years as well.

Your best bet is to just learn a proper programming language, as suggested by others. Just don’t expect results over night. It’s so much more work than what you probably think.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make a mmorpg?

item.title: How do you make a mmorpg?
item.dc:creator: @Ford_2_Race Ford 2 Race
item.description:
@Ford_2_Race wrote:

If your new to making games try these:

Gamemaker v7: http://www.yoyogames.com/gamemaker/try
Gamemaker v6.1: http://msn-cnet.com.com/Game-Maker/3640-2121_4-10626945.html

Keep in mind they only produce basic games.

There is a thread about game making in the 3rd Party Programs section if you haven’t noticed, which is where these links came from.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you make a mmorpg?

item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:5, topic:230635”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=303660.msg2435062#msg2435062 date=1221148361]
hmm… What about a good game then, fun to play but only needs one person to make?
[/quote]
First you need to learn C++ and OpenGL.[/quote]

You needn’t learn either. But…

Thug-life:

Learn to program.

item.title: How do you make a mmorpg?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

johno2:

hmm… What about a good game then, fun to play but only needs one person to make?

First you need to learn C++ and OpenGL.
Then you need an idea, good game, but easy to make.

Or you can use Flash and Action script, if you want to make Flash games.

Read full topic
